experience: You and Gail both know Aaron D. Bare, Evan Richmond, and 4 others

I am looking forward to sharing my caregiving journey on a bigger platform .  If you are in the throws of being a caregiver for a loved one this conference in Chicago is one not to miss!  It really helped me navigate the waters last year.  Hope to see you there!

If you want to be successful for the rest of your life, make this commitment: Every day I will build value, so I can share it with clients and colleagues. It’s going to be tough, though. We are so busy, building value falls to the bottom of our list. If you follow the advice in this video, you’ll learn how you can make investments today that will keep you relevant tomorrow.
Last year I applied to LinkedIn's summer internship program.
I was sold on the company, the culture, and the program.

After making it to the final round of interviews, I received the call and learned I didn't land the internship. When asked what I could’ve done better I was told that I was good but others were better. This was difficult news to hear as I wasn’t sure what I could’ve done to improve.
Nonetheless, I picked myself back up and sought out a couple of other internships continuing to grow, stay hungry, and expand my network.

Fast forwarding a bit: I applied to LinkedIn again, except this time for their full-time role for college graduates. It’s safe to say the hard work and persistence paid off as I was able to make it the final round, but this time receive a phone call with the good news!

I am very excited to announce that I will be joining the LinkedIn Business Leadership Program in the San Francisco office upon graduation! Looking forward to starting this new chapter of my life! #BLPnation
Special thank you to Andy Linder and Pedro Bañuelos for their help throughout the way.
In March of 2014 my heart stopped during childbirth.
In July of 2014 I was t-boned in an intersection and suffered a spinal injury.
The doctors thought I was exaggerating my pain.
They put me in physical therapy.
I was a stay at home mom.
In March of 2015 an MRI showed a herniated disc in my Thoracic spine.
In December of 2015 I had stem cell treatment in Portland.
In April of 2016 I was rear-ended. Again.
I suffered a herniated disc in my neck.
In September of 2016 I got separated.
In March of 2017 my ex husband died twice in the emergency room.
In April of 2017 he went to rehab for opiate addiction.
In April of 2017 I got a job as a recruiter.
I worked my butt off. I hustled all day, every day. I learned everything I could. I thought.  A lot.
In October of 2017 I started my own company with a goal to help single parents and families.
My parents believed in my dream. They sold their rental house to fund it.
I hired 30 people in a week. I signed contracts for resources for my employees worth $350,000 that I know I can pay.
Everything can change. Everything will change.
Keep going. Keep going. Keep going.

Offer accepted!  I am happy to announce that after nearly the longest seven months of my life I have accepted a phenomenal position.  It was tough turning down a couple positions since my layoff because they were not the right fit but it was well worth the wait.  Thank you to all that supported me and a special thank you to my awesome wife for being there for me.  Start date 11/6, bring on this new challenge!

You deserve better quality research. That means the intensity, richness, involvement and thoroughness of your research should evolve. With so many “off the shelf” social and big data solutions delivering huge amounts of raw information and feedback to you, testing assumptions with trustworthy research before you take action has never been more important to success. PhiPower is a full-service firm committed to advancing not only the efficacy of market research, but also the capacity of the science. Using our proprietary web-based technology platform, PhiPower is able to produce more immersive research.  As a result, PhiPower elicits much deeper levels of concentration from our respondents, delivering higher completion rates and superior-quality data. PhiPower collaborates with you to design well-defined research and survey strategies that communicate a clearer course of action for your business. Our cusom approach, experiential instruments and advanced methodology are relied on by litigators in court as well as industry leaders across a wide array of categories.When you partner with PhiPower, your organization benefits from our deep experience, creativity and commitment to the highest possible standards.  Our pursuit of perfection gets PhiPower to the heart of your business priorities, delivering a more complete and actionable understanding that inspires your organization to lead with confidence.Contact us so we can prove it to you.
Painted a school and added murals, part of a team to transform an inner city school.

recommendations: Moshe Weiss
29,000+ CEO @ Guerrilla Business Development | Leveraging Relationships for Business Development & Strategic Sourcing
February 24, 2014, Gail was a client of Moshe’s

Moshe is an extraordinary teacher, and I highly recommend him. He did classes with my son via skype in preparation for his Bar Mitzvah. Their was little time wasted, and the best part was my son not only learned, he appreciated Moshe and what he was learning. The classes flowed, and Moshe became more than a teacher. Moshe is devoted to his students and is a gifted teacher, I highly recommend his services and think that if you hire, him you will not be disappointed.

Alexandra is a driven professional. She constantly strives to make things happen and does it with a smile. From inception to completion, Alex is extremely capable, professional, thorough, and accomplished. If that is not a winning capability in these difficult times, I don't know what is! Alex wants everyone on her team to succeed and works from a creative place to create lasting results.Gail ConnCEOPhiPower Communications

summary: I am first and foremost a creative and integrated thinker.  I’m also a very keen observer with a unique attention for detail and aesthetic.  I see everything as connected.  I read everything and am a junky for information and knowledge.  Connecting the dots summarizes my work with brands and clients. My experience enables me to apply perspective and context to a broad spectrum of ideas, relationships, problems, groups and organizations.  People make the world tick and having intuition about people is the most important quality a person can have.I find that working in small, nimble organizations gives me much more flexibility and opportunity to do quality work that really makes an impact.  Within these dynamic and fast moving environments, I’ve become very adept at integrating the right mix of personal priorities that keep me inspired, with the skills sets and organizational discipline required to achieve objectives and produce results.In my present incarnation as the CEO of PhiPower, a cutting edge online market research company, I am active in the day to day business and very hands on with our clients.  This provides the perfect vantage point to blend my love of sales and marketing, generate fresh ideas, and synthesize innovative processes for companies who are developing proactive strategies for the 21st century. Specialties: Curation, identifying fringe opportunities and niche trends, market research and intelligence, team leadership, program management, lead generation, sales and marketing, content/in-bound marketing, business innovation and start-ups
name: Gail Conn
title: CEO at Phi Power Communications
